author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Upon the shores of commerce, Xpeng doth rise,
Its new-born steed, G6, seizes the prize.
A storm of gain, the crowd's delight,
In the electric dawn, it shines so bright.

A torrent of currency, the Eurozone pours,
Ahead of time, the treasury roars.
More bonds issued, a milestone surpassed,
In the looming squall of 2023 forecast.

Alas, the Euro, amidst inflation's tide,
Finds no strong wind by its side.
From German lands, the data was sent,
Yet brought it no proud ascent.

feedItems.title: Xpeng Shares Rise Sharply Amid Launch of Lower-Priced G6 Model
feedItems.description: Electric vehicle company XPeng Inc.’s Hong Kong-listed shares were sharply higher, after the company announced the launch of its new G6 sport-utility vehicle.

feedItems.title: Eurozone YTD Government Bond Issuance Run-Rate Seen Ahead of 2022
feedItems.description: Eurozone sovereigns’ government bond issuance for 2023 is progressing marginally quicker than in 2022, Barclays said, as supply year-to-date is €783 billion which represents an aggregate of around 60% of planned issuance for 2023.

feedItems.title: Eurozone Inflation Data Unlikely to Support Euro
feedItems.description: The euro failed to benefit from higher-than-expected German inflation data on Thursday and this doesn’t bode well for the common currency ahead of eurozone inflation figures later, UniCredit Research said.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Alas, mixed metals in the cradle of Zhao,
As goats tangle horns, yon fear begins to crow.
Worries, the hounds, gnaw on market bone,
Oh, the Chinese wind blows, full of unknown.

Oil, as the rabbit, bounds not far nor high,
Hopeful is the stance, as U.S stars align sky.
Economic words hum, like the evening's song,
In this dance of power, where does the tune belong?

Unexpected is the snail's slow descent,
Inflation drops in Gaul, to March's lament.
Eased are grain and hearth's fire, a calming pure,
Changes stir the broth, of this, we can be sure.

feedItems.title: Metals Mixed Amid China Demand Headwinds
feedItems.description: Metal prices were mixed as worries over Chinese demand continue to dominate the market.

feedItems.title: Oil Remains Range Bound Amid Expectations of Further Rate Hikes
feedItems.description: Oil prices were moving higher, amid more positive economic data coming from the U.S.

feedItems.title: French Inflation Dropped More Than Expected
feedItems.description: France’s inflation rate fell more than expected in June, reaching its lowest level since March 2022, as fuel and food prices continued to ease.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Fair Engie with her outlook strong and bright,
Guidance bold in earnings did ignite,
Strength in global trade and power gleams,
Flourish'd in the craft of energy dreams.

On Albion's isle, slight growth did unveil,
As costly living pressed without avail,
Inflation high and interest profound,
Still, the economy managed to rebound.

The Land of Rising Sun, her stocks did falter,
Pharma and trade houses touched the sacrificial alter,
U.S. strength did stir concerns anew,
About policies tightened, fear did accrue.

feedItems.title: Engie Raises Outlook on Strength of Global Energy Management and Sales
feedItems.description: Engie increased its 2023 earnings guidance on Friday due to the strength of its global energy management and sales business.

feedItems.title: UK Economy Expanded Slightly, Matching First Estimates
feedItems.description: The U.K. economy grew marginally in the first quarter of 2023, matching previous estimates, as a cost-of-living crisis impacted by high inflation and rising interest rates weighed on economic activity.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Falls 0.1%, Dragged by Pharma Stocks, Trading Houses
feedItems.description: Japanese stocks ended slightly lower, dragged by falls in pharmaceutical stocks and trading houses, as signs of U.S. economic strength rekindled concerns about the scope of policy tightening by central banks.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of SVB Bank's quite mysterious folly,
In far-off Cayman’s sandy dunes and holly,
Depositors, with nary a guaranty, 
Didst win, with God’s good reason, their petty.

In Britain's busy workshops, one, two, three,
Car-man does prove his fruitful industry.
His metal steeds, now green in energy,
In number and in virtue, rise like the sea.

Of new-found trouble in the East, we tell,
As China's dragon economy doth fell.
Is the Emperor's hand weak, who can dwell?
In God's good time, the story will nell.

feedItems.title: SVB Depositors Who Lost Their Money Win Court Victory
feedItems.description: Silicon Valley Bank’s customers in the Cayman Islands weren’t covered by a U.S. deposit guarantee program.

feedItems.title: UK Car Manufacturing Rises for Fourth Consecutive Month
feedItems.description: U.K. car production rose 27% in May, with hybrid and BEV volumes representing 35% of all cars made.

feedItems.title: China's Economy Shows New Signs of Weakness
feedItems.description: Evidence of China’s flagging growth continues to roll in, raising questions about whether the government is doing enough to turn things around.
